text: The Abbotsford Heat were a Canadian professional ice hockey team that began playing in 2009 and stopped in 2014. They played for 5 seasons in the American Hockey League and were the farm team of the Calgary Flames of the NHL. They played their home games in Abbotsford, British Columbia at the Abbotsford Entertainment & Sports Centre. The team struggled with financial problems and had low attendance near the end. The city of Abbotsford terminated their contract with the Heat on April 15, 2014. On May 5, 2014, The AHL's Board of Governors said at their spring meeting in Chicago that they had approved the relocation of the team to Glens Falls, New York for the 2014-15 AHL season. ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website Category:2009 establishments in Canada Category:2014 disestablishments in Canada Category:American Hockey League teams Category:Calgary Flames Category:Defunct American Hockey League teams Category:Ice hockey teams in British Columbia
